intro: Pseudoeriocoma, commonly known as the false eriocoma, is a genus of flowering plants belonging to the family Asteraceae. These plants are characterized by their composite flower heads, which consist of both ray and disk flowers. Pseudoeriocoma species typically grow in arid or semi-arid environments, showcasing adaptations to harsh climates. They often have hairy or woolly leaves that help reduce water loss. The genus is native to regions of southern Africa, where it thrives in rocky and sandy soils.
